subPoints: Effectove use of Pandas and its built-in functions
Good analysis of the correlation results
Correlation analysis - Well done
Plotting - Good, concise coding for the plot generation
Plotting - Nicely made plots containing all key elements
Plotting - Very nicely done!

neutral.mainPoint: The following functions might have been good to use in your solution
subPoints: `reset_index`
`loc` to easily operate over the columns
`sort_values` (Country name) would have been logical to after data cleaning, but fine.=
Delimiter (`sep`) - Incorrectly specified the separator used within the CSV-formatted file.
Header (`header`) - Incorrectly specified the header line.
Incorrectly read in the data.

Assignment Failure: You called a modification method (`drop`, `dropna`, `reset_index`, etc.) but failed to save the result by assigning it back (`df = df.method(...)`) or using the `inplace=True` argument. The change was lost.
Cleaning not done - You failed to drop duplicated rows.
Cleaning not done - You failed to drop rows with empty/missing cells.
Missing Value Handling - Missing values were not handled (dropped or transformed) prior to analysis/correlation.
Merging - The merge operation used was incorrect.
Sorting - The data was not sorted, or the sorting was incorrect/not saved.
Identification - Incorrectly identified the features that are most correlated.
Interpretation - Lack of interpreting what the correlation values mean (context is missing).
Interpretation - Incorrectly interpreted the correlation results.
`corr` - Did not use Pandas' built-in correlation function when required.
Absolute value - You needed to take the absolute value of some correlation results for analysis.
Not saved - The final processed data was not saved to a file.
Presentation - Data should have been formatted or presented in a clear Pandas table (e.g., using `to_string()` or styling) for better readability.
Saving index - Saving the default numerical index was unnecessary for the resulting data file.
The data was not plotted using the Pandas' built-in methods, which was a requirement for the assignment.
